Title.evidence: The aim of this study was to evaluate whether a fibrin sealant patch is able to reduce POPF in patients undergoing pancreatoduodenectomy with pancreatojejunostomy.

Trial_Design.evidence: In this multicentre trial, patients undergoing pancreatoduodenectomy were randomized to receive either a fibrin patch (patch group) or no patch (control group)

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either a fibrin patch (patch group) or no patch (control group)

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to evaluate whether a fibrin sealant patch is able to reduce POPF

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 142 patients were enrolled.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Forty‐five of 71 patients (63 per cent) in the patch group and 40 of 71 (56 per cent) in the control group developed biochemical leakage or POPF

Result_Outcome.evidence: Forty‐five of 71 patients (63 per cent) in the patch group and 40 of 71 (56 per cent) in the control group developed biochemical leakage or POPF ( P = 0·392).

Harms.evidence: There were no differences in postoperative complications (54 patients in patch group and 50 in control group; P = 0·839)
